p: The trace elements, i.e., Fe, Cu, and Zn of the halophytic plants, were determined from the dried plant’s powder, as reported by Johnsson [ 37]. The plants were dried at 70 °C for two days and sifted by a stainless-steel mill under 5 mm pore size. The dried materials (0.5 gm, each plant separately) were digested using a solution of concentrated HNO 3, HCIO 4, and H 2SO 4 (7:2:l) [ 37]. The trace elements were measured by ICP-OES (Model iCAP 7400 Duo, serial IC 74DC144208, China) instrument.
